abstract.p: Deals and Discounts column: Rock and Roll Hall of Fame and Museum, Six Flags Ohio and Seaworld in Cleveland are offering combination discount admission tickets through Labor Day weekend; EuroCruises charters riverboat Cezanne for seven-night cruises out of Avignon on Rhone and Saone Rivers; several promotions are being offered in Caribbean during iffy hurricane season; drawing (M)

block.p: COMBO TICKETS -- Admission to three attractions in Greater Cleveland -- the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame and Museum, Six Flags Ohio and SeaWorld -- is combined in a Wild Thing ticket that costs $49.95; $39.95 for children under 48 inches tall. Tickets, valid through the Labor Day weekend, are on sale at the three sites as well as in the visitor information center of the Convention and Visitors Bureau of Greater Cleveland, in the city's Flats entertainment district along the Cuyahoga River. The regular combined admission is $79.77, and $52.63 for children. The Rock and Roll Hall of Fame is in downtown Cleveland; SeaWorld and Six Flags are in Aurora, about 25 miles southeast. Information: (877) 937-9453.

CEZANNE CHARTERED -- EuroCruises, a New York company, has chartered the 49-cabin riverboat Cezanne for a seven-night cruise out of Avignon on the Rhone and Saone Rivers, priced from $2,150 a person, double, with air fare on Continental between Newark and Paris, and the train to Avignon. Cabins have two convertible sofa beds (except six queen-size cabins with a queen bed and separate couch, at $2,850) and air-conditioning. Shore tours, $35 to $100, include Arles and Beaujolais. Information: (800) 688-3876 or www.eurocruises.com.

CARIBBEAN SUMMER -- Promotions abound in the Caribbean at this time of year, for travelers willing to take a chance with the weather. (Hurricane season is typically at its peak from mid-August to mid-October.) Among the discounts:

The Elegant Hotels Group offers five nights for the price of four at its five Barbados properties, ranging from the 166-room Tamarind Cove Hotel, where a double starts at $258, to the 167-room Turtle Beach Resort, where $490 a night buys an ocean-view junior suite with meals, drinks and some activities such as snorkeling. Two children under 12 can stay in the room with their parents at no extra charge at all resorts except Coconut Creek. Good through Dec. 18; call (800) 326-6898.

The Hyatt Regency St. Lucia, which opened in April, is offering 50 percent off regular rates through Sept. 30; discounted prices start at $112.50 a night and must be booked by July 31. The 284-room resort, on a 1,000-foot beach, is six miles from Castries on the causeway to Pigeon Island. It has two lighted tennis courts, three restaurants and bars, a spa and water sports; (800) 233-1234.

At the Wyndham El Conquistador in Puerto Rico, an ocean-view room with access to the adjacent Golden Door Spa is $225 a person per night, double occupancy, through Dec. 18; the package includes tax, full breakfast and choice of a 50-minute spa treatment or a round of golf daily; there is a three-day minimum stay. The resort, on a bluff overlooking the Atlantic, about 45 minutes' drive east of San Juan, has six swimming pools and a casino. Call (800) 996-3426.
